What I think is hilarious is that Poppy was designed with the idea in mind to shut down mobile threats to keep the backline alive. Now they are nerfing her because she does her job and they were all "Oh shit, she actually does it well" (her last line of nerfs were literally because she was shutting down mobile fighters). All they need to do is increase her Q cooldown and mana cost. The reason she is so strong and does so much damage is because her Q is up every 3 seconds due to her main build path easily hitting the 30-40% CDR mark. The ability itself doesn't do that much until you get hit with it 3 times before your second rotation of spells comes back up.
Her kit is designed as not a tank or fighter but as an "Anti" to tanks, squishies, and mobility.

Because Riot hasn't realized that giving a tank with hyperscaling defenses an AoE %HP 2 part nuke was a horrible, horrible idea. If anything, it should have been her E that did %HP. 

That way she'd at least have to build AD and forgo some defense for her (now flat damage) Q to deal damage.
So, if I've got this right: You'd have the football tackle with a stun attached do %HP damage? Yeah, that'll go well I'm sure.

Normally she Q's immediately at the end of her E anyway. It wouldn't add or remove any damage to her engages/all-ins because if she gets the stun, both parts of Q would hit anyway. 

All it would do is effectively increase the CD on her 16% HP physical damage nuke.

Same burst, less DPS.

Use a little logic, please.

I'm going to repeat: You're going to put %hp damage... on a stun? 

People don't like stuns as is when they _don't_ have damage backing it up, moreso when they actually do. You're not going to spin that in any way that people would actually want to play against. You can say it'll be less DPS, but it'll feel worse. Not only that, her Q will be pretty crap in comparison. You'd shift so much power onto her E that she becomes absolutely reliant upon it for anything worthwhile in terms of damage despite it being more conditional than her Q. Riot tends to not want champions to have to put all their eggs in one basket, especially not when that basket will come with a stun (of decent 2s duration), flat damage, and percentage damage on top of that. That ability would end up being deemed overloaded pretty quickly, and they wouldn't be wrong. That would be a terrible move. 

No, what they should do: just nerf her damage overall. Shifting power to her E is not a good idea given what it already does.

You don't seem to understand the concept of the changes. 

WHETHER OR NOT POPPY LANDS THE STUN, SHE CASTS Q AT THE END OF HER CHARGE. 

This means that E->Q has LESS damage than currently possible if it DOES NOT stun. 

If she DOES land the stun, she'd be dealing LESS damage than currently possible because the %HP damage would be on a much longer CD. 

This would DECREASE her damage.

_______

There is absolutely no case where Poppy uses E and does not cast Q immediately after. 

_________

Another thing: Mao's W deals %HP damage. Its not overloaded. 


In fact, these changes would make her damage pattern much more like Mao's, rather than a target-agnostic tanky damage hypercarry.

Honestly I don't think Maokai's HP damage is healthy **because** it's on a point and click root. Imo the %damage from a tank should be avoidable so that their burst can be played around. Putting %heald damage on her E instead of her Q only makes it more reliable and harder to play around (and you'll get Poppy to max E first). 

Sion's is a great example of %health damage on tanks. There is noticeable counterplay to his shield bomb. Poppy just has an easier time landing both ends because of her wall stun or because people forget to walk out of it (possibly due to creep block).

Poppy would still max Q first for the same reason Maokai maxes Q first. 

Maokai would be cancer if his %HP damage was on his Q.

_______

Yeah, %HP damage on a point and click CC isn't the healthiest, but its healthier than what poppy currently has.
I doubt it would be. Honestly I'd rather they make her %damage scale with rank.

I honestly agree with this idea. If you're going to hit her laning, hit her earlier phases so she can't roll as quickly or easily. Don't make one of her abilities overloaded just because it would change her damage pattern because that ability now becomes incredibly hard to balance thanks to the parts of it involved, being flat damage, %hp damage, and it being a potential point-and-click CC that reapplies the flat and %hp damage. That's not something I think anyone wants. 

Raise the cooldown on her Q, make the %hp scale with rank, or maybe just nerf the %hp damage altogether, but don't just move the %hp damage to another ability and make it unnecessarily overloaded.

If Riot intends for Poppy to be a huge damage dealer and killer, they need to tone down her mitigation. She's one of the tankiest champions in the game and yet gets to kill people more reliably than assassins can. She can outduel literally every assassin, while building full tank, which would be fine if she didn't have a wealth of utility (or it took more finesse to use well).
Assassins SUCK at dueling tanks. Especially one like Poppy who has 95% single target damage and is supposed to be a good duelist.

Poppy's Q is AoE. 

I have no problem with her E, as the damage is incredibly situational. It's the Q and W that put her over the edge, especially W.
Q's AoE is literally only usable as an AoE ability for minions. Very rarely will you hit multiple champions with it.
That is what happens when you make a champion witha  spammable max% hp damage skill that can hit twice. It means you don't actually need to build damage to deal damage.

Sion's is spammable and does full damage. 

Honestly they should make her %health damage scale with levels.
